author: Katherine Clarke
title: Estate Sales Are Cool Again
text:
The wood wall paneling from Sweden was still there, as was the artwork and even the reddish-brown bedding. Normally, a home with decades-old décor might struggle to find a buyer.

But this was the Manhattan home of Greta Garbo, the movie star who retired from Hollywood and led an intensely private life—a choice that seemed to only deepen fans’ fascination. Last month, the apartment the actress called home for nearly 40 years sold for $8.5 million, or a 43% premium over its asking price. “The Garbo effect is the reason someone...
